# EU5_ILLUSTRATION_TAGS_REFERENCE.txt
# Complete reference for illustration_tags in Dynamic Historical Events (DHE)
# Required for proper event art display in EU5
# Format: illustration_tags = { 10 = mood 10 = setting }

# VALID MOOD VALUES (first value in pair)
# These represent the emotional tone/art style of the event illustration

# angry - Used for conflict, tension, or negative events
# regular - Neutral/default mood for standard events
# happy - Positive, celebratory, or successful events
# war - Military conflict, battles, or war-related events
# prosperity - Wealth, trade, economic success, or positive developments
# death - Mortality, plague, tragedy, or somber events
# ages - Age of Discovery/Exploration themed events
# armed - Military preparation, armed conflict, or defensive situations

# VALID SETTING VALUES (second value in pair)
# These represent the background/location context of the event illustration

# interior - Indoor scenes (palaces, chambers, meeting rooms)
# exterior - Outdoor scenes (battlefields, streets, landscapes)
# battlefield - Specific military combat scenes

# USAGE EXAMPLES
# illustration_tags = { 10 = war 10 = battlefield }     # Battle/war event
# illustration_tags = { 10 = prosperity 10 = interior } # Economic success in palace
# illustration_tags = { 10 = death 10 = interior }      # Tragedy in throne room
# illustration_tags = { 10 = happy 10 = exterior }      # Celebration outdoors
# illustration_tags = { 10 = angry 10 = exterior }      # Conflict outside
# illustration_tags = { 10 = regular 10 = interior }    # Standard diplomatic meeting
# illustration_tags = { 10 = armed 10 = exterior }      # Military preparation outdoors
# illustration_tags = { 10 = ages 10 = exterior }       # Exploration/colonial event

# REQUIRED SYNTAX
# - Must be placed in dynamic_historical_event block (not regular events)
# - Always use weight 10 for both mood and setting
# - Format is exactly: illustration_tags = { 10 = mood 10 = setting }
# - Missing illustration_tags will cause events to display without art
# - Invalid mood/setting values will cause art display failures

# COMMON PATTERNS BY EVENT TYPE
# Diplomatic events: regular + interior
# War events: war + battlefield, angry + exterior
# Economic events: prosperity + interior
# Tragedy events: death + interior
# Celebration events: happy + exterior
# Exploration events: ages + exterior
# Military events: armed + exterior, war + battlefield
